plugins.name: Icon Stitch
plugins.description:
Icon Stitch is a plugin for exporting icon sets as SVG sprites. It optimizes your icons for the web and exports them as a single file. Icon Stitch streamlines workflow by generating code for easy integration into your projects and is a time-saver tool for developers and designers who need to work with icons.


Key features:


- Create with a single click

- Optimize for performance and web

- Streamline your workflow with generated code

- Validate potential issues and resolve with ease

- Import SVG sprites to visualize file contents


The plugin contains paid features:


The free version allows you to create and export SVG sprites with up to 20 icons.

Consider upgrading to support development and lift the limit.


For technical support, feature requests, and general feedback, please create a new issue on the GitHub repository.


---


Icons from Icons Basic Set.

plugins.name: ContentFlow
plugins.description:
ContentFlow is the ultimate text manager for Figma, designed to keep designs, copy, and teams perfectly aligned. Whether you want to gather and review edits before updating your designs or streamline developer handoff, this plugin simplifies every aspect of text management.


Here’s what you can expect:

  1. ⏳ Postpone Text Updates: Accumulate edits without immediately applying them—batch updates or finalize them as needed.
  2. 🔎 Real-Time Change Detection: Automatically track every tweak in Figma, highlighting modified or removed text layers for quick review.
  3. 👥 Collaborative Updates: Every team member with the plugin sees changes in the file, ensuring everyone stays on the same page.
  4. ⏪ Complete Version History: Access a full log of edits anytime, and revert to previous versions in a click — ideal for instant rollbacks or detailed audits.
  5. 🏷️ Easy Status Labeling: Use four statuses (Progress, Done, Rejected, Dev) to clearly show where each piece of text stands.
  6. 🚀 Developer Mode: Give developers a clean interface showing only finalized content, with one-click copying and preserved formatting.
  7. 🌐 Smart Organization: Search and filter text by status, date, or keywords, with items neatly grouped by frames for instant clarity.
  8. 🎨 Adaptive UI: Switch between light and dark themes, and toggle to a compact layout when you need to save screen space—always keeping things clear and intuitive.


Keep your text workflow efficient, organized, and worry-free. ContentFlow ensures designers, writers, and developers stay perfectly synced with minimal fuss and maximum productivity!
plugins.tagline: A collaborative text manager to track updates, organize content, and streamline dev handoff.

plugins.name: Figma to Storyteq
plugins.description:
Turn your Figma designs into Storyteq dynamic editable ads.


The Figma to Storyteq Plugin enables designers to effortlessly export their Figma designs into Storyteq, turning static visuals into dynamic and customizable ad templates.


Streamline your workflow and scale content production with ease.


  1. Efficient Export – Quickly send your Figma designs to Storyteq in just a few clicks.
  2. Dynamic Template Creation – Convert static designs into adaptable templates ready for automation with Storyteq’s Ad Engine.
  3. User-Friendly Interface – Intuitive, seamless integration between Figma and Storyteq.


How It Works


  1. Design in Figma – Create your visuals as usual.
  2. Export via Plugin – Use the Figma to Storyteq Plugin to send Figma designs to Storyteq.
  3. Customize in Storyteq – Modify and manage your dynamic templates for automated content creation.


Use Cases


  1. Marketing Campaigns – Develop adaptable templates for various assets.
  2. Brand Consistency – Ensure design uniformity across platforms.
  3. Rapid Prototyping – Quickly generate dynamic versions of design concepts.



Getting Started


To begin transforming your static designs into dynamic ad templates, download the Figma to Storyteq Plugin today. This tool is exclusively available for users with an active Storyteq license. Follow these simple steps to integrate your designs with Storyteq:


  1. Sign up for Storyteq if you haven't already.
  2. Run the Storyteq Plugin within Figma.
  3. Authenticate your Storyteq account by logging in.
  4. Follow the plugin’s steps to export and customize your designs.


About


Storyteq helps global brands deliver content faster with the power of automation. Bring teams together to create pixel-perfect campaigns on brand, on time and on budget across markets and channels.


✔ Save Time – Reduce manual work and speed up content production.


✔ Ensure Consistency – Maintain brand integrity across multiple variations.


✔ Scale Easily – Automate and update templates effortlessly in Storyteq.
plugins.tagline: Turn your Figma designs into dynamic editable ads in Storyteq.

plugins.name: Better Title Case
plugins.description:
Not a fan of built-in Figma's title case? Better Title Case got your back!


  1. Select a frame or a group to apply Better Title Case to all text layers inside
  2. Or directly select one or several text layers to apply Better Title Case only to these layers


Safe to use on text layers that have several styles/properties applied to them — plugin will not remove bold or underlined text from your layers.


Current Capitalization Rules:

  1. UPPERCASE words are not processed, so AAPL or MBA will stay as is.
  2. The first and the last word in a sentence are always processed.
  3. There is a custom list of words that shouldn’t be in converted to Title Case: and, as, but, for, if, nor, or, so, yet, a, an, the, as, at, by, for, in, of, off, on, per, to, up, via, vs, v, (vs.) (v.)
  4. Word after em dash and slash processed even if it's a minor word.


If you have any feedback or ideas on improving the plugin — feel free to reach out via email or in comment section 😉.
plugins.tagline: Title Case Plugin We All Deserve

plugins.name: Table flipper
plugins.description:
Hey :)

This plugin lets you flip the table's layout, from rows to column, or columns to rows.

If the table is an instance, it will detach it.


If you like it, please like and comment. It will help others to see the value as well :)


Watch demo.

Support my work here <3


How to use:

  1. Select a frame that contains only a table
  2. Select the flip direction


Important notes:

Make sure to select the right direction, otherwise it will not work properly, and make sure the table is well built:

  1. Same amount of cells in all columns
  2. Same amount of cells in all rows
  3. Same width to all cells in row/column

Otherwise it will not work properly. Super important to how the plugin works.


How it works behind the scenes:

I calculate how many cells the table has by:

  1. How many rows/columns
  2. How many cells the first row/column has (I assume all others have the same number of cells).
  3. I go in a loop and re-arrange the table ( rows/columns * cells times)


Enjoy :)


(Image source: https://www.flickr.com/photos/skkorea/13529912033)
plugins.tagline: Flip table's layout direction from rows to columns / columns to rows

plugins.name: Liquid Glass
plugins.description:
Liquid Glass creates high-fidelity, scalable glass effects for modern UI designs. Transform any component with sophisticated multi-layered glass effects that automatically scale to fit your design.


✨ Features:

- Light Mode and Dark Mode themes to match any design system

- Create pre-configured glass components or apply effects to existing designs

- Preserves original colors with adjustable opacity (optional)


Perfect for creating modern, elegant interfaces with depth and dimension. Whether you're designing tab bars, buttons, cards or custom components, Liquid Glass delivers Apple-inspired glass effects with just a few clicks.


Based on Apple's WWDC25 design language, this plugin brings the latest UI trends to your Figma workflow.
plugins.tagline: Create stunning, scalable glass effects inspired by Apple's modern UI design

138131.description:
Liquid Glass creates high-fidelity, scalable glass effects for modern UI designs. Transform any component with sophisticated multi-layered glass effects that automatically scale to fit your design.


✨ Features:

- Light Mode and Dark Mode themes to match any design system

- Create pre-configured glass components or apply effects to existing designs

Perfect for creating modern, elegant interfaces with depth and dimension. Whether you're designing tab bars, buttons, cards or custom components, Liquid Glass delivers Apple-inspired glass effects with just a few clicks.


Based on Apple's WWDC25 design language, this plugin brings the latest UI trends to your Figma workflow.
138131.release_notes:
What's New in Liquid Glass 2.0 🚀
I'm excited to announce a major update to our Liquid Glass plugin, bringing you more powerful tools to create Apple-inspired glass effects in Figma!

New Features
Dual-Mode Interface 🎨  
* Create Components Mode: Generate pre-built UI components with glass effects
* Apply Effects Mode: Transform your existing designs with customizable glass treatments

Advanced Distortion Layer System 🎛️
* New "Realistic" Glass Texture: Adds subtle distortion for authentic glass effects
* Smart Sizing: Automatically scales 15% larger than parent element
* Canvas Stacking Aware: Works with both "First on top" and "Last on top" settings (for auto-layouts, for the rest it will be sent to back automatically)
* Toggle Control: Optional distortion layers to balance realism with performance

🔄 Improvements
* Smarter Instance Handling: Clear communication when instances need detaching
* Context-Aware UI: Interface adapts based on your current selection
* Performance Optimizations: Lighter application with optional distortion layers

🛠️ Technical Enhancements
* Intelligent Layer Management: Proper z-index handling for all layout types
* Adaptive Behavior: Works with auto-layout, frames, and various shape types
* Theme-Aware Fill Management: Specialized settings for dark and light backgrounds
* Error Prevention: Automatically handles clipping, constraints, and conflicting properties

🔮 Coming Soon
* Improving the out of the box components categories and variants
* Enhanced customization options for texture effects

Thank you for using Liquid Glass! This update was developed with input from the Figma community to create the most accurate glass effects possible. We look forward to your feedback and seeing what you create with these new tools!
138131.tagline: Create stunning, scalable glass effects inspired by Apple's modern UI design

plugins.name: Ungroup with BG
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to ungroup frames while preserving their background colors, corner radius, and strokes. When you ungroup a frame that has background styles, the plugin automatically creates a rectangle with the same styles at the same layer position.


Features:

• Preserves background colors and opacity

• Maintains corner radius settings

• Keeps stroke styles

• Retains the original layer position

• Automatically selects the new background and ungrouped elements


背景色やストロークが設定されたフレームをグループ解除する際に、それらのスタイルを保持するプラグインです。背景スタイルを持つフレームをグループ解除すると、自動的に同じスタイルの四角形が同じレイヤー位置に作成されます。


機能：

• 背景色と不透明度を保持

• 角丸の設定を維持

• ストロークスタイルを保持

• 元のレイヤー位置を維持

• 新しい背景と解除された要素を自動選択
plugins.tagline: Ungroup frames while preserving their background styles

plugins.name: Time2Frame
plugins.description:
A powerful Figma plugin that lets you analyze, adjust, and visualize animation settings in real-time—enhancing precision and efficiency in motion design.


How It Works:


1. Animation Data Extraction

Instantly retrieve animation properties from selected frames, including:

  1. Animation Type: Move In, Fade, Smart Animate, and more.
  2. Direction: Left, Right, Top, Bottom.
  3. Easing Curve: Ease In, Ease Out, Linear, Custom Spring.
  4. Timing Details: Delay and duration (in milliseconds).

Effortlessly gain insights into how animations behave within your prototypes.


2. Frame Rate Conversion

Easily convert animation timing into frame counts based on industry-standard frame rates:

  1. 24 FPS
  2. 30 FPS
  3. 60 FPS

The plugin automatically recalculates delays and durations into frames, ensuring precise control over motion timing.


3. Real-Time Input Adjustments

Modify Delay and Duration values directly in the plugin and see instant updates in:

  1. Milliseconds (for precise timing).
  2. Frames (for seamless animation alignment across FPS settings).

No need for manual calculations—Time2Frame does it all for you.


4. Animation Preview

Visualize how your animation moves, scales, and fades with an interactive preview. The preview dynamically adjusts to reflect extracted animation properties, allowing designers to fine-tune their animations with confidence.


5. Custom Spring Curve Calculation & Visualization

If a Custom Spring easing is detected, Time2Frame breaks it down into:

  1. Stiffness
  2. Damping
  3. Mass

The plugin generates a real-time graph that illustrates the spring curve, making it easy to refine complex motion dynamics.


Key Features:


  1. Animation Data Extraction – Retrieve animation type, easing, and timing in seconds.
  2. Frame Rate Conversion – Automatically convert timing into frames for 24, 30, or 60 FPS.
  3. Instant Adjustments – Modify animation values with real-time updates.
  4. Live Animation Preview – See how animations behave with accurate visual feedback.
  5. Custom Spring Analysis – Break down spring physics and visualize easing curves.
  6. Smart UI Integration – Works seamlessly with Figma’s native environment.


Who Is It For?


Time2Frame is built for motion designers, UX/UI designers, and developers who need precise animation breakdowns and real-time adjustments in Figma. Whether you’re fine-tuning micro-interactions or optimizing complex motion flows, this plugin streamlines your workflow and improves animation predictability across different frame rates.
plugins.tagline: Designed for motion designers—select a frame, instantly analyze its animation settings in real time.

plugins.name: Frameverse
plugins.description:
Frameverse - Share Frames Seamlessly


Frameverse is a powerful Figma plugin that revolutionizes design sharing. Generate secure tokens for your frames and assets, allowing instant access across teams and continents. Share specific design elements without exposing your entire file, maintaining control while enabling seamless collaboration.



✨ Key Features


- One-Click Sharing: Select any frame, section, or slice and generate a shareable token instantly

- Smart Import: Paste a token to import frames with perfect fidelity, maintaining all properties including:

- Layout structures and constraints

- Shapes and component instances

- Vector paths and effects

- Fonts and text styles

- Images and fills


- Batch Operations: Share or import multiple frames at once

- Preview Panel: Visual preview of selected frames before sharing



🎯 Perfect For


- Design System Teams sharing component updates

- Agencies sharing design patterns with clients

- Product Teams maintaining consistent layouts across files

- Anyone looking to transfer frames between files without manual recreation



💡 How It Works


1. Select the frames you want to share

2. Click "Generate Token" to create a unique share code

3. Share the token with your team

4. Recipients paste the token to import frames with all properties intact (Eg: YJS-hoo)



🔒 Security & Performance


- Tokens are temporary and expire after 24 hours

- No data persistence - files are fully purged after token expiration

- Share specific frames without exposing entire files

- Intelligent compression and processing for optimal performance

- Progressive loading for larger frames



No account required. Start sharing frames in seconds!



Questions or feedback? Contact us
plugins.tagline: Exchange assets with the most intuitive frame sharing solution for Figma

plugins.name: Eggstractor
plugins.description:
Design-to-code, simplified


Eggstractor is a Figma plugin that exports designs as SCSS mixins, allowing developers to build components their way while keeping styling updates seamless. By separating structure from styling, Eggstractor ensures that design changes don’t disrupt component architecture. And with automated code generation for updates, dramatically speed up iteration and reduce development overhead.


Designers: Easily update component designs and push them directly to code—no developer implementation needed.


Developers: Maintain full control over component structure while receiving Figma-driven style updates as branched pull requests for review before merging.


For an end-to-end setup and demo, check out our Getting Started Guide.


How It Works

  1. Connect to your GitHub repo.
  2. Structure your coded components to use SCSS mixins.
  3. When designs change in Figma, run the plugin to generate updated SCSS mixins.
  4. Review, then click to create a pull request.
  5. A developer reviews and merges, and the changes are live.


Current Status

Eggstractor is actively in development. While not all CSS properties are supported yet, our roadmap includes full support for core CSS properties, followed by an open-source design system built to leverage Eggstractor.


Eggstractor is an open source project by Bitovi. Contributions are welcome! Get involved at github.com/bitovi/eggstractor.


Need some help?

Check out our Getting Started Guide.


Need more help?

Chat with us on Discord | Send GitHub feature requests | Email to support@bitovi.com


Need pros to help design & build your design system or app? That’s Bitovi!
plugins.tagline: Design-to-code, simplified

plugins.name: DT组件筛选 DT Component Selector
plugins.description:
Introduction:

The DT Component Selector plugin is a Figma tool designed to quickly filter and locate DT components in your design. This plugin helps designers improve their workflow by efficiently identifying and managing DT components in complex layouts.


Function Description:

  1. Filters all components in the selected frame that match the DT component criteria.
  2. Categorizes components into those visible on the canvas and those outside the visible bounds.
  3. Supports quick location of selected components for further manipulation.


How to Use:

  1. Select a frame and click the "Show Component Filter" button.
  2. The plugin will automatically filter the qualifying DT components, displaying the results as visible and non-visible components.
  3. Click the "Locate" button next to a component to quickly locate it in your design.


Notes:

  1. The plugin filters only DT components that match predefined criteria, ignoring other types.
  2. Make sure to select a frame for the plugin to function correctly.


介绍：

DT组件筛选插件是一款用于快速筛选并定位设计中的DT组件的Figma插件。该插件旨在提高设计师在处理复杂设计时的工作效率，帮助用户更快速地找到并操作DT组件。


功能说明：

  1. 筛选出当前画板中符合DT组件定义的所有组件。
  2. 可对组件进行分类：在画板可见范围内和不可见范围内的组件。
  3. 支持快速定位所选组件，并进行进一步操作。


使用方法：

  1. 选择一个画板并点击“显示组件筛选”按钮。
  2. 插件会自动筛选符合条件的DT组件，结果将分为可见组件和不可见组件进行展示。
  3. 点击组件名称旁的“定位”按钮即可快速定位到该组件。


注意事项：

  1. 插件仅会筛选符合预定义条件的DT组件，其他组件将被忽略。
  2. 请确保您选择的是一个画板，否则插件将无法运行。

plugins.tagline: Quickly filter and locate DT components in your design

plugins.name: Smart Rename
plugins.description:
Smart Rename is a powerful Figma plugin built to streamline your workflow by letting you bulk rename frames customizable base names and smart suffixes like version numbers, dimensions, or sequence numbers.


It also fixes a common frustration in UI design: decimal positioning. When frames have non-integer X or Y values, exported assets often end up with unwanted white lines or blurry edges. Smart Rename solves this by auto-aligning frames to the nearest whole pixel, ensuring clean, sharp exports every time.


From organization to export-readiness, this plugin saves time and eliminates manual, error-prone tasks—all in a few clicks.
plugins.tagline: Bulk rename and align Figma frames in seconds. Add version, size, or number suffixes effortlessly.

plugins.name: Populate JSON data
plugins.description:
✨ JSON-to-Design Plugin

🚀 Supercharge Your Design Workflow


Bring your templates to life with data-driven automation! The JSON-to-Design Plugin allows you to effortlessly populate and duplicate designs using simple JSON files.


Key Features


✅ Upload JSON Files

Supports two formats:


  1. Array format: Automatically duplicates selected designs for each object in the array while replacing placeholders like {{name}} and {{surname}}.


{
"array": [
{ "name": "John", "surname": "Doe" },
{ "name": "Emma", "surname": "Walker" },
{ "name": "Liam", "surname": "Harris" }
]
}


  1. Object format: Updates a single design with JSON values without duplication.


{
"name": "John",
"surname": "Doe"
}


✅ Dynamic Placeholder Replacement

Replace {{name}}, {{surname}}, or other placeholders in text elements with real data—seamlessly integrate information into your designs.


✅ Save Time and Effort

Eliminate repetitive manual tasks by automating data entry and duplication. Perfect for projects requiring consistent layouts with unique data sets.


How to Use

🎯 Follow these simple steps to get started:


Upload Your JSON File

Upload a correctly formatted JSON file using the plugin. Choose between the array format or object format depending on your use case.

Select the Layer

Highlight the Figma layer containing text objects with placeholders like {{name}} and {{surname}}. Ensure these placeholders are named correctly.

Click “Populate Design”

Let the plugin work its magic! It will duplicate designs or populate data based on your JSON file.


💡 Tip: Double-check placeholder names in your design to match JSON keys for smooth operation.


Why Choose JSON-to-Design?


💡 Smart Automation: Unlike other plugins, this tool simplifies both duplication and data replacement in one intuitive flow.

⏱ Time-Saving Magic: Whether you’re working with a few data points or hundreds, let the plugin handle the heavy lifting while you focus on creativity.
plugins.tagline: The plugin allows you to upload a JSON file and, based on it, populate designs with this data.

plugins.name: Voice to Text for Figma
plugins.description:
Easily insert text into Figma using your voice!

Click “Open Voice Tool” → Start speaking in the browser → Your speech will be transcribed and automagically added into your selected Figma text layer.

No typing. Just talking.


✅ Use Case 1:

“Tired of switching between docs and Figma just to copy-paste written content?”

Speak directly into the plugin’s voice tool and instantly push the transcription into your selected text box—no tab switching, no distractions.


✅ Use Case 2:

“Want to insert longer text into your Figma design without typing it all out?”

Use Voice to Text for Figma to dictate your content and have it transcribed directly into your design—perfect for mockups, user flows, or note-taking during brainstorming.


Supported Features & Limits:

✅ Languages Supported: English, Arabic, Chinese (Simplified), Dutch, French, German, Hindi, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish

🕐 Time Limit: Records up to 60 seconds per session, auto-warns you before timeout

🌐 Browser Compatibility:

✅ Supported: Google Chrome, Safari, Opera, Samsung Internet

⚠️ Partially Supported: Microsoft Edge, Firefox

❌ Not Supported: Internet Explorer, Brave, Arc

🧠 Auto-restart: On silence to ensure smoother capture

🎙 Microphone Permission : Detects and guidance for Mac & Windows users.

🖥️ Figma Compatibility: Works seamlessly on both Figma Browser and Figma Desktop / Mac App

✅ Accessibility Enhancements

❤️ Open Source Code: https://github.com/mryeshwanth/voice-figma-plugin


How it works:

  1. When you click Open Voice Tool, a new browser window will open to start recording.
  2. This is required because Figma Mac/Desktop plugins can’t access your microphone directly.
  3. The tool uses your browser's built-in Web Speech API (SpeechRecognition) to transcribe your voice locally — nothing is sent to any external server.
  4. Once done, the transcription is securely sent back to the Figma plugin and inserted into your selected text node.
plugins.tagline: Convert your voice to text, directly into Figma.

plugins.name: Dummy Details Filler
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that helps you populate your designs with dummy data. Unlike other data generators, this plugin gives you precise control over your generated content through customizable options for each data type. This is perfect for mockups, prototypes, and design presentations.


Data Types:

  1. Generate various types of realistic data:
  2. Full Names (International names from different cultures)
  3. Usernames (Customizable patterns)
  4. Email Addresses (Custom domains and formats)
  5. Phone Numbers (US, UK, France, Germany, Sri Lanka formats)
  6. Physical Addresses
  7. Company Names
  8. Job Titles
  9. Dates (Short, Long, ISO, European formats)
  10. Numbers (Custom ranges)
  11. Lorem Ipsum (Custom length)
  12. Passwords (Adjustable length and complexity)
  13. File Names (Various types and extensions)
  14. Domain Names
  15. IP Addresses
  16. Color Codes (HEX, RGB, HSL)
  17. Zip/Postal Codes (US, UK, Canada formats)
  18. Cities (Global selection)
  19. Countries
  20. UUID
  21. Prices (Multiple currencies and formats)
  22. Account Numbers
  23. Currency Symbols & Codes
  24. URL-friendly Slugs


Each data type comes with its own set of customization options, allowing you to generate exactly the kind of data you need for your designs. Whether you're creating a simple contact list or a complex dashboard, Dummy Details Filler helps you create more realistic and meaningful mockups quickly and efficiently.


Made with ❤️ by Yasir Ahamad
plugins.tagline: Fill your designs with dummy data instantly with more control!

plugins.name: Recent frames
plugins.description:
Work faster by quickly navigating back to the frames you recently worked on. The plugin displays a small window with a history of Figma frames you clicked. You can use the back button to quickly go to your last frames. Only top-level frames are listed; nested frames are ignored.


Features:

  1. Back button to quickly navigate to a previously selected frame.
  2. List of recent frames: a single click centers the frame in your view, while a double-click auto-fits the zoom.
  3. Light and dark mode with native Figma UI style.
  4. Menu with special actions: quickly jump to the selected node in your local main component or select the same child node in all component instances.


Why I Created It:

I built this plugin because I work on complex Figma prototypes. I often need to copy something from a distant frame and then jump back to where I was working. I sometimes forget where I was in the project. I wanted a simple way to undo and return to my previous spot without any hassle.


Use Cases:

  1. Effortlessly undo your navigation by returning to the last frame you clicked.
  2. Quickly jump between components and your working frames.
  3. Present your design flows without manual panning and zooming.
plugins.tagline: Instantly jump to your last frames with a back button

plugins.name: Stellar - Streamline Your Design Handoff
plugins.description:
Stellar 🚀 empowers you to create organized and professional documentation for your design handoff. With four robust tools, you can structure your Figma files in a clean and intuitive manner.


Frame Identifier - Ideal for pinpointing specific screens or components.

Easily create clear headers to identify individual frames:

  1. Select any frame or group of elements.
  2. Add a title and subtitle.
  3. A polished header will be generated above your selection, enhancing clarity and organization.


Section Identifier - Perfect for grouping features or user flows.

Organize related frames with cohesive section headers:

  1. Select multiple frames that belong together.
  2. Add a section title and description.
  3. A header will be created that spans across all selected frames, providing a unified view.


Flow Identifier - Essential for tracking progress and communicating state.

Document your navigation flows with intuitive status indicators:

  1. Select frames within your user flow.
  2. Add a title and description.
  3. Choose a status (e.g., In Progress, Ready for Development).
  4. Status tags are color-coded and include helpful icons, making it easy to convey the current state.



Connector Arrows - Connect your frames with intelligent arrows.

Seamlessly link frames with dynamic arrows:

  1. Select two or more frames to connect.
  2. Choose from 4 arrow styles: Default Arrow (clean and simple), Success Arrow (positive flows), Error Arrow (error states), Dashed Arrow (alternative paths).
  3. Toggle between light and dark modes for optimal visibility.
  4. Arrows automatically adjust to frame positions, ensuring a tidy and logical layout.


Perfect for:

  1. Design Systems
  2. User Flow Documentation
  3. Development Handoff
  4. Project Status Tracking
  5. Team Collaboration



Start organizing your Figma files with Stellar and create documentation that both designers and developers will appreciate! 🚀🚀🚀
plugins.tagline: Streamline your design handoff with organized headers, sections, and smart connectors

plugins.name: MGS Composer - Exporter
plugins.description:
Export your Figma Design into a Microchip Graphics Composer Project

Streamline your design workflow with the MGS Composer Exporter. This plugin bridges the gap between Figma's design environment and MGS Composer, enabling you to create stunning user interfaces in Figma and transfer them to Composer for further development.


Features

Automatic Asset Generation: Composer generates assets automatically from the exported data, saving time and effort.

Preserved Design Hierarchy: Composer mirrors Figma's design tree as closely as possible, ensuring an accurate translation of your design.

Component Support: Assets generated from Figma Components are treated as a shared resource, saving memory on your target device.


Detailed Guide


How to Use:

  1. Install the Plugin: Add it to your Figma workspace.
  2. Run the Plugin: An export window will appear on the right side of Figma's interface.
  3. Select Page: Navigate to the page you want to export from and click Select Page.
  4. Mark Objects for Export: The export window will list top-level objects. These will be translated to Screens in Composer. Select objects by clicking on them or their children in the Figma design, which will automatically mark them in the export window.
  5. Set Export Options: After selecting objects, choose from two options:
  6. Flatten Group Components during export: Flattens groups into a single image in the exported data.
  7. Export all primitives as .svg assets: Exports vectors like rectangles, lines, and text as SVG assets.
  8. Generate Data: Click the Generate Data button. The export window will show a view of all exported objects and a corresponding JSON file. You can add custom properties to the objects here in the upper view.
  9. Export File: Click the Export button at the bottom of the window and select a location to save the file.
  10. Open MGS Composer: Launch Composer and create a new design or open an existing one with a screen size adequate for your Figma content.
  11. Import Project: In Composer, go to "File > Import" and select Figma Composer Project. Confirm the prompt that appears.
  12. Done: Composer will import the file and add new screens, assets, and widgets to your design.


Support & Feedback:

MGS User Guide

MGS Forum
plugins.tagline: Exports your Figma Design into a Microchip Graphics Composer Project.
